content: very basic baby beanie janet russell twistedknitter on ravelry yarn approx 100 yards sportweight yarn for one hat gauge 5 5 st/in unstretched gauge needles double-pointed needles in a size that gives you the desired gauge notions tapestry needle for weaving in ends choose your needle size based on the recommended gauge of 5 5 stitches per inch or begin with the needle size recommended on your chosen yarnʼs ball band while you could start your hat on a circular needle rather than double pointed needles dpns i prefer to use dpns throughout since this baby hat has a very small diameter and the number of cast on stitches i call for do not spread around a circular needle comfortably therefore this pattern is written for a set of 4 dpns 3 dpns to hold the stitches as you knit them and 1 dpn with which to knit the stitches off each needle other knitting methods to try that do not involve using dpns are magic loop and knitting in the round on two circulars there are many helpful video tutorials to be found online i prefer these if you have dpns http //verypink com/2011/04/27/getting-started-with-dpns/ magic loop http //verypink com/2012/10/17/simple-magic-loop/ joining in the round http //verypink com/2010/03/13/video-joining-in-the-round/ instructions cast on 72 stitches on one double-pointed needle redistribute stitches slipping purlwise so that 24 stitches are on each of three double-pointed needles join to knit in the round while making sure your stitches arenʼt twisted knit 1 to 2 of k2 p2 ribbing begin knitting every round until the hat measures 5 25 from the cast on edge and begin decreasing for the crown © 2008-2014  janet d russell  www twistedknitter com crown decreases round 1 k6 k2tog repeat to end of round repeat to eor - 63 stitches round 2 knit around round 3 k5 k2tog repeat to eor 54 stitches round 4 knit around round 5 k4 k2tog repeat to eor 45 stitches round 6 knit around round 7 k3 k2tog repeat to eor 36 stitches round 8 knit around round 9 k2 k2tog repeat to eor 27 stitches round 10 knit around round 11 k1 k2tog repeat to eor 18 stitches round 12 knit around round 13 k2tog repeat to eor 9 stitches round 14 knit around to finish cut a 12 length of yarn and thread a tapestry needle weave yarn through the remaining 9 stitches and tug gently to close the opening poke the needle through a nearby stitch to the underside of the hat and weave in ends cut yarn wash and block hat according to guidelines on the ball band and lay flat to dry experiment with different needle sizes and yarn weights to get a smaller or larger hat based on this stitch count and your gauge for this pattern the hat will fit a 13 - to 18 - diameter head please visit the ravelry pattern page for the very basic baby beanie to see the different yarns other knitters
